discussion.p: /7 says "Copy constructors for these container types obtain an allocator by calling allocator_traits<allocator_type>::select_on_container_copy_construction on their first parameters." However, /8 says that this takes const Alloc&, not a container. /7 goes on to say "Move constructors obtain an allocator by move construction from the allocator belonging to the container being moved." so we can follow that wording.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N3691.

blockquote.p: -7- Unless otherwise specified, all containers defined in this clause obtain memory using an allocator (see 17.6.3.5). Copy constructors for these container types obtain an allocator by calling allocator_traits<allocator_type>::select_on_container_copy_construction on their first parametersthe allocator belonging to the container being copied. Move constructors obtain an allocator by move construction from the allocator belonging to the container being moved. […]
